faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without special restrictions or requirements to obtain a Spanish visa. You will need a Spanish tax identification number (NIF) for the purchase process, which your lawyer will arrange. Non-residents should understand foreign investment tax obligations.

faqs.question: What are the typical costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, expect to pay approximately 6-8% in additional costs, including property transfer tax (typically 6-10% depending on region), notary fees, registry fees, and lawyer fees. It's advisable to budget for these when calculating your total investment.

faqs.question: Is rental income from Spanish property taxable?
faqs.answer: Yes, rental income is subject to Spanish taxation. Non-residents typically pay 19-24% tax on rental income with various deductions available for expenses, maintenance, and utilities. Consult a Spanish tax advisor for your specific situation to optimize tax efficiency.
